name: the sound of rain. (Q.)
description:
• A spatial take on parser-based interactive fiction;
  • New creepy-gloomy art with pencil/watercolour aesthetics and expanded background music;
  • Built-in text-to-speech support, reduced motion, high-contrasting text, and configurable font faces and sizes for different accessibility needs.
Controls:

On touch devices, you can press the virtual keys on screen. See detailed keyboard and gamepad controls in the Kate manual.

Button Keyboard Uses Arrow keys Navigate menus;
Change options;
Select in-game choices Z Confirm menu selection;
Advance text X Toggle auto-forward A Previous page in options;
Rollback S Next page in options;
Skip text  (Menu) Left Shift Open game menu  (Capture) Left Ctrl Take screenshot;
Hold one second to start/stop recording a video Credits:

Written, illustrated, and programmed by Q.

With music assets from rosko vair and MokuseiNoMaguro;
Background sound assets from straget and szczur_banshee;
Sound effect assets from various artists on Pixabay and Freesound.

Fonts are Gloock, Roboto, and Lora.

Complete credits are displayed at the end of the game. Full licences and links can be viewed by holding down Menu and selecting Legal Notices. 

Platform support:

A reasonably modern machine and a modern browser are required to play. Note that the game does not work on Firefox or non-Safari browsers in iOS. See Kate's known issues here, and detailed system requirements here.

Code and assets

The source code for this game (written in Ren'Py, but not really cleaned up) is available on GitHub. Code is released under a MIT licence, and CGs drawn for this game are released under a CC-BY-4.0 licence. Music and other assets remain a property of their respective authors, under their own terms.
